To meet the needs of our students, we are delivering meals to families through our bus routes. If families have notified us regarding student dietary needs or food allergies and have registered for meal delivery, then we are able to make accommodations to meet student health needs.

You can register for food delivery at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSe1E--SFGdvyDt8qicZvb3RwhfSYXKRlY3IDGTaoDLn4sguDA/viewform or if you don’t have internet, you may call your child’s school.

We deliver standard meals to students unless you have notified the school nurse regarding appropriate dietary accommodations. It is the responsibility of families to notify the nurse at the school your child attends regarding these accommodations, and it is the responsibility of families to do a final check of the provided meals to ensure safety.

We are all in this together, and together, we will get through these difficult times. We appreciate your cooperation ensuring that our students get healthy and appropriate food.

Students and Families,

We look forward to starting next Tuesday. It is going to be different, and this a brand new way of having school that we have never attempted. The bumps in the road next week are going to be plenty. That said, we are here for you and will make adjustments as soon as possible. If there is confusion next week or if you have a concern, please call the school your child attends. We are here to help you, and we will find solutions.

We will start the year with the same enthusiasm we’ve always had. Simply put, we can’t wait to teach your children.

Look forward to seeing you Tuesday.

Mark Y. Lineburg, Ed.D.
Superintendent

Please contact your child's health care provider to discuss his/her immunization needs for the upcoming school year. Newly enrolled students will also need a physical. Planning ahead to complete these state requirements for school enrollment will ensure a smooth and safe start when schools reopen.

The Code of Virginia requires that children receive a comprehensive physical examination(§ 22.1-270) within 12 months prior to the start of school and be adequately immunized (§ 22.1-271.2) before entering public kindergarten or elementary school. Other required immunizations include Human Papillomavirus (HPV) for girls entering sixth grade; and a Diphtheria, Tetanus, and Pertussis (Tdap) booster for entry into seventh grade.

Please contact your child's school if you have any questions.

Dear Families,

It was discovered Friday evening that one of our food service workers tested positive for the COVID-19 virus. Fortunately, this worker was
asymptomatic, and we are hoping for a full recovery. As a result of the positive
test, the Virginia Department of Health conducted the protocol of contact tracing to identify potential infected persons. The tracing identified a number of food service employees who will be in quarantine until May 11, 2020.

As a result of the quarantine, we are suspending food distribution at all of our schools until May 11 to ensure that we have a full workforce. We understand the need for food products for our students and families. We look forward to resuming in full on May 11 and continuing throughout the summer.

In working with the Virginia Department of Health, we were informed that there was not additional risks to families who picked up food from our schools.

Most sincerely,

Mark Lineburg

April 30 at 2:26 PM ·

Public Service Announcement
For those people going to the middle school to pick up lunches on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, there will be a new traffic pattern. We have been coordinating with school officials in an effort to insure the safety of motorists travelling on Halifax Road by the middle school when these lunches are being picked up. Southbound traffic on Halifax Road by the middle school has been backing up between the hours of 11:00AM and 1:00PM , creating a traffic hazard. To ensure the safety of everyone, starting Friday, May 1, all those picking up lunches will need to turn in the southern most entrance by the middle school and go behind the tennis courts and through the middle school bus parking lot. The South Boston Department of Public Works will have message boards in place instructing motorists where to turn.
We all ask for your understanding as this change is implemented to ensure everyone's safety. Please share this with everyone in your contacts.

Governor Northam has ordered all schools be closed for a minimum of two weeks. Halifax County Public Schools will be closed from March 16, 2020 through March 27, 2020.

Beginning Monday, March 16, 2020, meals will be available for students at designated sites. Meals will be available on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 11:00 AM – 1:00 PM. The designated sites will be Halifax County Middle School, Scottsburg Elementary, and Sydnor Jennings Elementary. Students must be with their parents to pick up meals. Social distancing methods will be used to distribute meals and may include a drive through pick-up.

We will keep in touch with families through our alert system, webpage, and social media throughout this time period in regards to safety, food, and instructional services for our students.

We encourage everyone to stay home and practice germ prevention. You can find resources from the CDC on our website.

Dear Families and Students,

Our community has been devastated by the tragic incident that occurred last night in South Boston. We offer the most heartfelt condolences to the families and friends of the victims.

Over the course of the day, we have been in frequent contact with law enforcement. Law enforcement officials do not believe this matter has a link to Halifax County High School nor were any of those involved in the tragedy current Halifax County High School students.

Concern and even fear are natural after such a tragedy. Therefore in the days ahead, we will have all metal detectors operational at the high school. We will have extra law enforcement personnel on site. Families and students should be aware that when we fully implement the use of metal detectors, there could be delays in entering the building.

In addition to extra security measures, there will be counselors available for students and staff.

Sincerely ,

Mark Lineburg, Superintendent
Michael Lewis, HCHS Principal
